item.title: In Surprise TED Talk, Pope Francis Asks The Powerful For 'Revolution Of Tenderness'
item.description: April 26, 2017 - The pontiff's message seemed to be directed at the audience in the room. "The more powerful you are," he said, "the more responsible you are to act humbly. If you don't, your power will ruin you."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 26, 2017 - The pontiff's message seemed to be directed at the audience in the room. "The more powerful you are," he said, "the more responsible you are to act humbly. If you don't, your power will ruin you." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/26/525699847/in-surprise-ted-talk-pope-francis-asks-the-powerful-for-revolution-of-tenderness

item.title: Energy Star Program For Homes And Appliances Is On Trump's Chopping Block
item.description: April 26, 2017 - Appliance makers and home builders are in Washington, D.C., to celebrate the energy efficiency program. Energy Star is among 50 EPA programs that would be eliminated under the president's budget plan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 26, 2017 - Appliance makers and home builders are in Washington, D.C., to celebrate the energy efficiency program. Energy Star is among 50 EPA programs that would be eliminated under the president's budget plan. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/26/525584142/energy-star-program-for-homes-and-appliances-is-on-trumps-chopping-block

item.title: Morning News Brief: Trump's Tax Plan, North Korea, Killings On Facebook Live
item.description: April 26, 2017 - President Trump will announce his tax plan Wednesday. Also, Holly Bailey of Yahoo News talks about a briefing Senators will receive on North Korea, and another killing was broadcast on Facebook Live.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 26, 2017 - President Trump will announce his tax plan Wednesday. Also, Holly Bailey of Yahoo News talks about a briefing Senators will receive on North Korea, and another killing was broadcast on Facebook Live. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/26/525675131/morning-news-brief-trumps-tax-plan-north-korea-killings-on-facebook-live

item.title: Facebook Responding To Another Broadcasted Killing
item.description: April 26, 2017 - A man killed his infant daughter in Thailand and broadcast it live on Facebook. It comes just after the company dealt with another killing on Facebook Live that happened in Cleveland.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 26, 2017 - A man killed his infant daughter in Thailand and broadcast it live on Facebook. It comes just after the company dealt with another killing on Facebook Live that happened in Cleveland. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/26/525675168/facebook-responding-to-another-broadcasted-killing

item.title: Flying Cars Are (Still) Coming: Should We Believe The Hype?
item.description: April 25, 2017 - Airbus and Uber are planning for a future of flying cars and sky taxis. "You literally push a button and you get a flight," an Uber executive says. But will our Tomorrowland ever really arrive?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 25, 2017 - Airbus and Uber are planning for a future of flying cars and sky taxis. "You literally push a button and you get a flight," an Uber executive says. But will our Tomorrowland ever really arrive? http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/25/525540611/flying-cars-are-still-coming-should-we-believe-the-hype

item.title: China Moves To Increase Number Of Electric Vehicles On Its Roads
item.description: April 25, 2017 - By early next year, Beijing will require automakers in China to ensure that at least 8 percent of all vehicles they manufacture are electric.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 25, 2017 - By early next year, Beijing will require automakers in China to ensure that at least 8 percent of all vehicles they manufacture are electric. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/04/25/525412342/china-moves-to-increase-number-of-electric-vehicles-on-its-roads

item.title: Hacking Lake Erie: Tech Competition Seeks Solutions To Water-Related Problems
item.description: April 24, 2017 - A technology competition seeks solutions to Lake Erie's biggest problems, including harmful algae blooms and aging water systems. Teams in cities around the region are competing for thousands of dollars in prize money and consulting services to create apps and other tools.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - A technology competition seeks solutions to Lake Erie's biggest problems, including harmful algae blooms and aging water systems. Teams in cities around the region are competing for thousands of dollars in prize money and consulting services to create apps and other tools. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/24/525441604/hacking-lake-erie-tech-competition-seeks-solutions-to-water-related-problems

item.title: The Warfare May Be Remote But The Trauma Is Real
item.description: April 24, 2017 - Drone pilots and intelligence analysts who work with them may not be in physical danger themselves but "no doubt are war fighters" who experience psychological stress, says the Air Force.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - Drone pilots and intelligence analysts who work with them may not be in physical danger themselves but "no doubt are war fighters" who experience psychological stress, says the Air Force. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/24/525413427/for-drone-pilots-warfare-may-be-remote-but-the-trauma-is-real

item.title: Dogs Are Doggos: An Internet Language Built Around Love For The Puppers
item.description: April 23, 2017 - DoggoLingo is a rising language on the Internet that's full of cutesy suffixes and onomatopoeias. It might even change the way you talk to your pet.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 23, 2017 - DoggoLingo is a rising language on the Internet that's full of cutesy suffixes and onomatopoeias. It might even change the way you talk to your pet. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/23/524514526/dogs-are-doggos-an-internet-language-built-around-love-for-the-puppers

item.title: High-Tech Luxury Juice Start-Up Faces Low-Tech Problem
item.description: April 23, 2017 - The company Juicero sells bagged juice and expensive high-tech presses, but customers realized they could squeeze the juice by hand. Lynn Neary talks with Bloomberg's Olivia Zaleski about the company.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 23, 2017 - The company Juicero sells bagged juice and expensive high-tech presses, but customers realized they could squeeze the juice by hand. Lynn Neary talks with Bloomberg's Olivia Zaleski about the company. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/23/525310236/high-tech-luxury-juice-start-up-faces-low-tech-problem

item.title: Murder Video Again Raises Questions About How Facebook Handles Content
item.description: April 21, 2017 - A murder video uploaded to Facebook brought attention to how the company monitors upsetting content. Artificial intelligence may be a solution, but experts say it could bring unwanted results.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - A murder video uploaded to Facebook brought attention to how the company monitors upsetting content. Artificial intelligence may be a solution, but experts say it could bring unwanted results. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/21/525042474/murder-video-again-raises-questions-about-how-facebook-handles-content

item.title: Juicero CEO Says Luxury Juicer Is 'Much More' Than Juice; Internet Is Unimpressed
item.description: April 21, 2017 - The company says its $400 machine cold-presses juice out of packets sold via subscription. Then a Bloomberg News video showed people didn't actually need the press to get juice from the packets.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - The company says its $400 machine cold-presses juice out of packets sold via subscription. Then a Bloomberg News video showed people didn't actually need the press to get juice from the packets. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/21/525055713/juicero-ceo-says-luxury-juicer-is-much-more-than-juice-internet-is-unimpressed

item.title: Maurice Conti: Can Machines Think And Feel For Themselves?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - Futurist Maurice Conti says we've entered a new era where machines and humans partner to do what neither can do alone. He calls it the "Augmented Age."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - Futurist Maurice Conti says we've entered a new era where machines and humans partner to do what neither can do alone. He calls it the "Augmented Age." http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524702119/maurice-conti-can-machines-think-and-feel-for-themselves

item.title: Marco Annunziata: What Will Human-Machine Collaboration Mean For Our Jobs?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - GE's Chief Economist Marco Annunziata is optimistic about "the marriage of minds and machines" — provided we manage it the right way.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - GE's Chief Economist Marco Annunziata is optimistic about "the marriage of minds and machines" — provided we manage it the right way. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524701908/marco-annunziata-what-will-human-machine-collaboration-mean-for-our-jobs

item.title: Erik Brynjolfsson: In A Race With Machines, Can We Keep Up?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - MIT Professor Erik Brynjolfsson sees a bright future where machines serve as powerful tools and partners. But he says we can only shape this future if we keep up with the pace of innovation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - MIT Professor Erik Brynjolfsson sees a bright future where machines serve as powerful tools and partners. But he says we can only shape this future if we keep up with the pace of innovation. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524700928/erik-brynjolfsson-in-a-race-with-machines-can-we-keep-up
